Trauma History: The patient reflects on past experiences, including getting kicked out of high school, which he wishes he had handled differently. He acknowledges the impact of these events on his life.
History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient mentions feeling a bit more depressed due to being away from friends and family, but states that it is manageable.
Medical and Psychiatric History: The patient has not been diagnosed with PTSD or depression.
Psychosocial History: The patient shares insights about his move from Saint Louis to L.A. for work opportunities in game design. He describes the differences in lifestyle and pace between the two locations, expressing both positive and negative feelings about L.A.
Mental Health Observations: The patient describes himself as shy but capable of controlling his temper. He is generally perceived as funny, caring, and easy to get along with.
Physiological Observations: The patient reports being a little tired but generally doing well. He mentions that he sleeps well, although he occasionally experiences grogginess when he doesn't sleep well.
Current Functional Status: The patient engages in activities like playing guitar, listening to music, and spending time with friends to relax. He enjoys playing video games with friends during his ideal weekend.
Therapeutic Interventions: The patient copes with feelings of depression by talking to friends and focusing on happy memories.
